intro: Allantoma, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or purple. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, Allantoma thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant's botanical features include a compact rosette structure and a shallow root system adapted to conserve moisture. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
